website_summaries.verdict: This duck-down mummy bag should keep you warm between when temperatures are between 30°F and 50°F, but is rated for survival at 15°F.
pros: Durable mummy-style bag with duck down filling
Water repellent 400T 20 D  ripstop nylon fabric liner with double large YKK zippers
Varied lower limits for men and women
cons: May arrive with an odor, but this should dissipate

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, but narrow shoulders
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag, soft and comfy. Slept down to 28 degrees, in a gimmick with an underquilt. I am 6' 205 lbs, broad shoulders. I can't zip it all the way up, too narrow, I need about 6 more inches in shoulder area. I carry a blanket to put orotund my shoulders. Length is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Landis

customer_reviews.title: Great for warmth, not great for packing up
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Super warm, velcro doesn't stick to other parts of the bag Cons: Material is shiny garbage bag looking (so I don't know how close you should put it to a campfire); It doesn't just stuff into the compression bag, instead it's time consuming - you have to be careful of how you put in the compression bag - it matters the direction because otherwise the air gets trapped within it; I find the best thing is to actually fold/roll it from the bottom to the top and then work it into the sack.
customer_reviews.author: NDubs

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, used it while hunting and camping on ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, used it while hunting and camping on a ridge this winter, the bag kept me warm enough to have to unzip a little despite heavy winds and snow on the tent. Light enough to pack in and compresses to a small size.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: They shipped the wrong product in the right compression sack.
customer_reviews.text: Literally just opened the box I received only minutes ago to see the nice compression sack for my Hyke amd Byke Quandary 15 degree bag. Looking forward to using on a trip this planned for this weekend. Obviously I was very disappointed when I opened the compression sack to see a $5 Eureka POS sleeping bag in pink and purple that would best suit a 3 year old girl sleeping on her living room floor for family movie night. Someone obviously switched the bag out at the distribution center. I really hope they get it right on the replacement. More to come...
customer_reviews.author: Mega dog5000

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift to my wife for our backpacking and camping trips. She originally has a youth size 20 degree rated bag which she loves. She was surprised that I bought her another bag. She loved the color and when she tried it, she liked that she has more wiggle room than her old bag. It's maiden voyage was at Havasupai Falls and the temp dropped to 30 degrees in early morning. She was comfortable all throughout and even had to unzip a couple of times since she was also wearing thermals; appreciated the additional loft of the sleeping bag since she used an ultralight Air pad. Would definitely recommend to buy this excellent quality sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: KatoK19

customer_reviews.title: Not Down with this hardly down bag
customer_reviews.text: I am very concerned about this bag. I have owned several down sleeping bags over the years and none have been so short of down. There is not a significant down barrier, at best this puffs out at maybe 2” as opposed to 5 or 6” like my other bags do. This is supposed to be warm at subfreezing temps. I doubt it very much. The vendor is very cordial but I would not stake my comfort on a trip in the summer or the fall here in CA. Very disappointed. Was hoping to replace my Northface bag with this and help a “new” American company. Big mistake.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Not that good
customer_reviews.text: You can't wash it like a normal sleeping bag. And it can' stay compressed for storage. It has to be spread out and stored under a bed or something. I have a coleman that is way better and was almost half the price of this bag. Price is way too high.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Hill

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase this sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: The bag is not baffled correctly. All the down falls to the bottom or sides of the bag so the sleeping bag has zero down. It’s like the sleeping bag is just the nylon shell and no down in between.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Matsumoto

customer_reviews.title: Plastic!
customer_reviews.text: Please don't buy plastic... it glistens like cheap plastic too... and you literally feel you are in a grocery bag. Plz don't buy this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Rachna Chopra

customer_reviews.title: First foray into sleeping bags after being spoiled by Army Sleep System
customer_reviews.text: I went camping three times with this bag over late fall and winter. With a sleeping pad I was snug as a bug with temperatures that were 25 degrees Fahrenheit. The bag compressed to about 1\2 the size of an Army sleep system so I think it's biggest selling point is its mix of good compactness and good warmth. Are there more compact sleeping bags? yes. are there warmer sleeping bags? yes. This bag is a great mix of the those two characteristics for a good price? yes. The first two times I didn't know how to use the "shoulder-shelf" but after I got the hang of it, I was a fan.
customer_reviews.author: lurkbob

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, Warm, Feathers Everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I really like this sleeping bag for the most part. It's kept me comfortably warm in 30 degree weather, the material is extremely soft and it packs back into the bag with no problem. It's been excellent for backpacking due to the compact size. My only problem is that every morning I wake up covered in feathers. My friends like to joke that I must have killed a goose in my sleep. I can't figure out where they're coming out of, and it's not a major problem so far, just an annoyance to get cleaned off after every use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: STINKING UP MY WHOLE HOUSE!
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. Really well made. Contrary to other reviews, the zipper seems well made. Very comfortable and fits well. BUT SMELLS SO BAD I CANT BE IN THE SAME ROOM AS IT. I'm giving it 24hours to air out. If it doesn't do the trick, then I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: LAriver

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sleeping bag for fall and spring camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this based on reviews and I love it! I took it on a camping trip to Canadian Rockies and I must say it was surprisingly warm, to the point where I was had to open it up a bit on slightly warmer nights. It might actually be a bit too warm for camping in hotter climates. It's also really comfortable and you don't feel cramped in it. I'm a very fidgety sleeper and I never felt like I was straining the bag. It also did not get wet with dew in the morning, even though there was some serious dew on my tent. Highly recommend for fall and spring camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awful product
customer_reviews.text: Not what it claims, it's a 32 f at most. It smells like 2 week old roadkill. Never buying from bike&hike .....awful product It deserves 0 stars
customer_reviews.author: hemofilus

customer_reviews.title: Sleep in Heavenly Peace, Enjoyable for a long, long Time.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, my best pair of sleeping bags EVER. And I've *never* seen customer service as good - customer care prior to purchase sharing thoughtful usage and maintenance tips, more useful supporting information upon purchase including a solid guarantee, with a thoughtful follow-up email to ensure customer satisfaction with more maintenance tips should folks get their sleeping bag dirty (hard to imagine considering the outside finish. If you can afford a high quality sleeping bag that will last for many years, a sleeping bag that's lightweight yet guaranteed to keep you toasty beneath freezing temperatures, a bag that easily rolls up to one-tenth it original size, than the Hyke and Byke is the sleeping system for you!
customer_reviews.author: Michael L. Nistler

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT A 15oF BAG. Still, a good bag.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this one 5+ camping trips at from 4,000-10,000+ ft elevation, with night temperatures from 35-55oF and was never hot, but noticed the cold at 40oF. I would not trust this bag near freezing temperatures. Zippers are great, fit is tight but a little short, and I am average height. Not a bad bag at all, but the temperature labeled is maliciously misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Cross

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: What I expected when I received this sleeping bag was a sweaty, cramped plastic feeling sleeping bag that would do the job. What I experienced was totally opposite. This sleeping bag is fantastic. Yes it looks like a plastic garbage bag but it feels great to sleep in. The regular size is not too narrow to move around in and it didn’t make me sweat like other sleeping bags I’ve used. On top of that it is light and packs up pretty small. I have no complaints as of yet and I hope it lasts for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Frosty

customer_reviews.title: Not a 15° bag - slides around
customer_reviews.text: I loved the ability to stuff this into the tiniest package - and it's so light. Kept me warm in 40° overnight temps but I can't imagine it being warm enough for 15° as it's rated for. I slept on top I got really annoyed at the constant sliding over the place, it woke me up constantly. I slept on a great mat, an insulated klymit static V and I was sliding off that thing all night. Considering either returning or adding some silicone rubber strips to my mat - but I don't want that to potentially catch and tear the sleeping bag... :-\
customer_reviews.author: Katie C.

customer_reviews.title: Super light - Packs Tight - Not fun in weather below 30 degrees
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is the nicest bag I have owned. Its compact, light, seems well made and is spacious. I made the mistake of taking it camping on a trip where the temperature dropped below 20 suddenly and I nearly froze. I did have a lot of condensation build up. Due to the down fill it lost all its heat retention. Not sure who thinks you can survive at 15 degrees in this thing, maybe on a really dry night. I think they should bump up the rating a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Campbell

customer_reviews.title: I sleep on this often even at home!  Great hiking sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I haven't owned enough sleeping bags since I started camping as a kid in the early 70's, but maybe 15 or so? This is by far my favorite!! Had it in Yellowstone and on a few segments hiking the Colorado Trail, at temp's right around freezing. I was cozy with my undergarments on. I'm 6'2" and about 220lbs (currently lol) and I was super comfortable in the one I purchased. Plenty of room throughout. It was actually slightly too long at the feet but that turns into a plus (at least for me) as I'll use it as additional insulation when cold.
customer_reviews.author: David F

customer_reviews.title: So warm
customer_reviews.text: I just got my sleeping bag last night. Well, as it turned out, the temp got down to 16. I took it out onto the back porch, and was only going to stay inside the bag for about 30 minutes. Well, about an hour and a half later, I woke up realizing I fell asleep. It was SO comfortable and warm. Can't wait to take it backpacking. And as other reviews have stated, I too looked at other brands but I can't justify spending $300 or more for a sleeping bag. The price was right and I am very pleased with my bag.
customer_reviews.author: av8tor92

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t make it through the first night
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this sleeping bag based on the many positive reviews. So far, after one overnight hike, it isn’t holding up. I settled in this comfy bag, went to zip it up and poof! The zipper zipped off the end resulting a cold uncomfortable night of sleep. I am sure my experience would have been different if the zipper wouldn’t have failed. I have contacted the manufacturer to see how they respond about getting it repaired or replaced. Maybe I should have gone with the more expensive Marmot I had my eye on.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.text: I went through a long hiatus in outdoor activities and now I am back. So needed to start from scratch. I researched several bags made by different manufacturers that met both quality and price. This one came on top and so far I've used it twice. Of course, it's warm where I live and hard to tell how warm it'll keep me when it's cold out. For the time being, it's working nicely.
customer_reviews.author: sam6959

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable down to 30 F. Bleeds feathers.
customer_reviews.text: Currently using it at a remote site in Alaska. The coldest it's been is around 35 F. Was still warm enough, but I think any colder than like 30 F would be pushing the capability of this bag. It's very comfortable, I gotta say. Problem is, this thing bleeds feathers everywhere. All my clothes are covered in little white feathers. Also, this doesn't pack small so not the most ideal for backpacking unfortunately. I'd give it a 3.5 if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Staingo Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: The impossible stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: You guys either have an impressive packing machine or 4 heavyweight boxers packing this bag in the stuff sack. I work up more of a sweat "trying" to get this to fit in the sack than hiking 20 miles in a day. You do your customers a disservice with such an undersized stuff sack. I get you want to make the whole package small, but this is NOT working for me.
customer_reviews.author: Gorgehiker

customer_reviews.title: Needs a better Zipper
customer_reviews.text: I Really liked this bag unfortunately there was one huge flaw thus 3 stars instead of 5. It was a great light weight warm sleeping bag that compressed small, My issue was with the zipper. It initially got stuck the first time I unpackaged it. I was able to temporarily free it, but when I went camping it was stuck again and I had to climb in and out through a small opening. Very frustrating for the money I spent. I contacted the company which responded quickly but just instructed me how to zip and unzip. This was not the help I expected.
customer_reviews.author: sbcagirl

customer_reviews.title: Read Before Buying
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t get it all the way zipped up and velcroed, it was such a tight fit that it kept unzipping. I had a sleeping bag over that and a blanket and froze at 46 degrees in a tent...kept sliding around, tossing and turning and was fully miserable. I’m not ever camping again....hated it and got zero sleep. And now I can’t return it because it’s passed the 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Glorioso

customer_reviews.title: Temperature rating
customer_reviews.text: Overall, a great first experience with this sleeping bag. Pros: comfortable and soft to the touch. Easy to pack and lightweight what I was looking for. Cons: temp got down to 28F at Crater Lake when I first used bag and I got a little chilly. I do most of my backpacking spring/summer/fall when night temp is above 40F, so this is the right bag for me. I would recommend a bag liner for below 25F with this bag. Be very careful with fires around bag. Ambers can melt material.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Bag fluffed up in about ten minutes of removing from bag.I got inside to test the warmth and I have to say, even before it was fluffed I started to get pretty toasty.All in all I'm very excited to take this out and I have confidence that it will keep me warm!
customer_reviews.author: Sleepyritz

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic bag and I got a good deal on it. It's very light weight for a 15 degree bag and feels great sleeping in. I'm 5'10" 215lbs. I just spent 8 nights in it and most nights the temps dropped into the low 20's. I used a Chillax sleeping pad, silk bag liner, ArcTeryx base layer, cap, and Sea to Summit pillow. I was surprised at how warm and comfortable I was all night. Very impressed with the overall function of the bag. Just a little advice, zip it open and closed carefully as the zipper is prone to snag.
customer_reviews.author: hotcouple

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality!
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't had a chance to actually utilize this sleeping bag, my first initial impression of it is that it's very lightweight, durable, made with excellent craftsmanship and materials and compact. I have an upcoming PCT thru-hike slated for 2019 that will put this gear to the fullest of tests. I will resubmit a review then. Happy trails!!!
customer_reviews.author: John Cordeiro

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sleeping bag! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Took this to Seattle to camp in one of the many national parks there soon after getting it and it’s so comfy! I’m 6’2, 220 and it fits me wonderfully. I came prepared with socks as some reviews complained about it getting cold by the feet. It all else fails, pick yourself up a cheap mummy bag liner! They add degrees to the rating keeping it warmer and will keep it clean better.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Blair

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag and amazing customer support
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! When I first received the bag I was shocked at how small it compresses! After a few minutes of airing it out it regained its fluffiness and size. Spent two nights camping. First night temps dropped to low 30’s. The second night temps were in the 20’s. I wore layers and the bag kept me very warm. I actually had to remove a layer the first night and slept like a baby the second.
customer_reviews.author: TainoCruz

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I used the sleeping bag for 6 days in remote Kenya on a self sufficient race. The sleeping bag looked bulky but once I pushed it down in my backpack it stayed compressed. It was light weight and the extra length allowed me to snuggle down in the nights. The temperature dropped to low of 30 degrees and the bag was not warm enough. I would recommend warm extra layers to keep warm. The foot area especially was colder than an other area. Overall the bag did well. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Palmer

customer_reviews.title: A must buy!
customer_reviews.text: The best thing EVER!!! I slept in the car for a week in Iceland, the weather was high 20s to low 40s. This was the best sleeping bag, I was so warm. NEVER cold and I am a VERY cold person (I was born and raised in San Diego, CA and never left hahaha so I don't know what cold is). Some nights I didn't even have to zip it up. All I wore was one pair of thermals that I got at walmart that were fruit of the loom. I did use a hand warmer or 2 because they are amazing, but I didn't have to.
customer_reviews.author: chelsie aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Down at a decent price!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, yea, 5 stars and I haven't actually slept in it yet! Expecting to enjoy it soon on a solo trip into silence and solitude at a delightful spot I haven't been to in 43 years, when I was a seasonal fisheries aide. I expect it will do fine on top my new pad from Klymit (Static V) and tent from Alps Mountaineering, not to mention the Scout 3400 backpack from Teton Sports! Yep, all great companies making great gear at reasonable prices!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick R. Watters

customer_reviews.title: Updated Review
customer_reviews.text: Went camping in this bag twice, last time over the weekend of March 13-15 202 in southeast Oklahoma. Winds and temp got down to about 38 degrees but, wearing a long sleeve nylon shirt, pair of socks and shorts, was nice and toasty. Zippers worked great, did not have any issues with zippers at all. For my first cold weekend, the bag was awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... same overpriced tag as other sleeping bags but I love this sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical as its not as the same overpriced tag as other sleeping bags but I love this sleeping bag. It’s lightweight and you can squeeze them to feet perfectly on your pack. I have camped with this on a 25 degree weather, although I also used them when it was around 15, it was miserable cold and wished I had a liner, but my colleagues at that trip had the same issue with the more expensive sleeping bags.
customer_reviews.author: k123

customer_reviews.title: Glamping Camping Comfort
customer_reviews.text: Nothing to dislike. This is a well made bag. I've paid more for bags in the past from well known companies that weren't this nice. Light weight, too. It comes with a compression bag for transporting it. Should be stored long term out of the bag fluffed out on a hanger to maximize best insulation capacity.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Butler

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal Going For A Down Bag
customer_reviews.text: Used this all over the place camping. Packs up small and has kept me warm. I have not pushed the temperature rating, I use this all year round but the coldest temps I've camped in are probably around 20 degrees or so. I'm 6 foot 3, 200 pounds and I have plenty of room in the long. The regular size sleeping bags are too short for me. I haven't lost any loft on it over the time I've had it. I always hang it to dry after a trip and have been impressed with the quality for the price. This is a great bag if you don't want to spend hundreds on a good down bag.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a lightweight bag that would keep me warm in three seasons, and I sleep cold. This bag is it. Light, compress-able, comfortable - it has all the features a backpacker needs. I slept in it four nights on a Thanksgiving trip that dipped below freezing at night, and I slept comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: OK Cards Fan

customer_reviews.title: 6'4" 290lbs and still room in 'LONG'
customer_reviews.text: Just unboxed the bag! First backpacking trip is next year. Took it out for a quick fit test. I'm 6'4" and 290lbs. I ordered the LONG. FITS PERFECTLY WITH ROOM TO GROW! I mean room to move. I better not be growing haha. Id say it's good for up to 6'6" or so before you run into length problems.
customer_reviews.author: Tabatha M

customer_reviews.title: Great budget friendly sleeping bag. Narrow shoulders.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this bag twice now since I've got it and Its my first down sleeping bag. It performed great and very comfortable. Biggest con was the narrow shoulders. It was in the low 50s so I just kept it open and used it more as a quilt. Very impressed with the down. The exterior material seems very light but tough. Water repellant was very good. Some rain drops got on it and they rolled right off.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: Great bag, when the bag loftes up it is extremely warm. The bag is lighter and packs down smaller than my other bags that i own and use backpacking, the bags i have used do not keep me as warm as this bag. This bag is good if your going to backpack, the compression stuff sack is hard getting the bag into but the bag compresses down to the size of a football.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still cold at night.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for winter back- and bike-packing in the midwest. I've used it a couple of times in upper 20 degree weather and I've been cold enough that I couldn't sleep any of those nights. I also use a 15 degree insulated Nemo pad. Pros to this bag: it's packable and fluffs out so nice with just a couple shakes. It's soft and has just the right amount of room inside. I just wish it kept me warm at night.
customer_reviews.author: DaniB56

customer_reviews.title: Rubicon Certified.
customer_reviews.text: I was able to test it when I went on my Rubicon trip in October. I think it got down in the low 30’s and I was kept warm and toasted through the night. I was just in my underwear too. I sleep pretty warm so I know I will no issue with this sleeping bag. It’s compresses small enough to fit in my hiking backpack. Which works out great when I want to do some other adventures.
customer_reviews.author: JD Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Just a fantastic bag
customer_reviews.text: This thing is warm, super comfortable, soft, compressable, light, and just a well-built bag. Addtionally, I can stretch my full length (6'3") with my toes extended and not feel cramped. This bag is great. If I ever need another down mummy bag, hyke and byke is it. Totally awesome bag.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Ultralight, warm & great value.
customer_reviews.text: Tried it out after receiving it having followed the instructions I received from the seller it proved to be an excellent sleeping bag. Very comfortable, kept me nice and cosy and it proved to be ultralight in my backpack. I would buy again from Hoke & Byke and liked that they were interested enough to follow up on my satisfaction. Get out there and buy one yourself, you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Killala

customer_reviews.title: excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: kept me plenty warm in 30-40 nights. probably be too hot in the summer. although i sleep quite hot. i ended up sweating if the temperature is higher than 65 degrees at night while sleeping. remember to keep your head out kn a down bag. your breath will soak the inside of your bag and you will freeze. that happened to me one night in this bag. i hung the bag to to dry out on a bush in the sun on the following day.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this sleeping bag a year ago for my son for Christmas who was crossing from cub scouts to Boy Scouts in February. He has used it several times and has loved it. This weekend they slept out in man made shelters and he brought this bag. He was warm and comfortable overnight when temps dipped down to about 13 degrees. We now recommend this sleeping bag to parents of new potential scouts who are looking for a quality affordable winter weather sleeping bag. We also have a zero Degree version my husband uses as the scoutmaster and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Billie S.

customer_reviews.title: 15deg? I don’t think so.
customer_reviews.text: Decent made bag. All the features you’d want. But no way this is a 15deg bag and yes I understand how bag temp ratings work. Even with base layers, mid layers, and my puffy jacket on a 35deg night I was extremely cold. This bag does not have the fill or loft enough to claim a 25deg rating, much less a 15deg rating.
customer_reviews.author: M16gunner

customer_reviews.title: Good first sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this sleeping bag for a while and used it on a few trips. I think it’s a great bag for the price and would definitely recommend it. My last trip was rainy and temps were between 40-50 degrees and I was very warm at night! My only complaint is that the down feathers come out occasionally but other than that I love it! And the storage bag squeezes down to be quite compact too!
customer_reviews.author: Mary W

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Bag
customer_reviews.text: It's a fantastic bag. I bought it to replace TNF's Green Kazoo, which is also a fantastic bag. My Kazoo was stolen and the Hyke and Byke Quandary is of the same quality for a fraction of the price. Thank you, Hyke & Byke. However, if I have one complaint, I'm not stoked on the compression sack. I would prefer the bag include a light-weight stuff sack without compression straps -- that's just extra weight and makes for an uncomfortable pillow. All in all, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: joseph sweet

customer_reviews.title: Comfy at 40 degrees or warmer for the average person. 32-32 for someone that runs warm.
customer_reviews.text: Comfy and high quality. BIG disclaimer though that 15 degree means essentially you can survive in that temp. My wife runs pretty average heat and was FREEZING on a 30 degree night. Had to go to town to get her a zero degree degree rates bag to also sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: N. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: It's super light, super comfortable and definitely keeps me warm
customer_reviews.text: Finally had a chance to try my new sleeping bag from Hyke & Byke. I didn't realize the technology had come this far since I bought my last bag. It's super light, super comfortable and definitely keeps me warm. I use this for motorcycle camping, so space is a real premium. Rolled up, it's probably 1/3 the size of my previous bag but much warmer, lighter, and more comfortable. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. Schacker

customer_reviews.title: The bag appears to have good quality. I have not had the opportunity to ...
customer_reviews.text: The bag appears to have good quality. I have not had the opportunity to use it, but it is very thick and will most likely be very warm. It doesn't pack up quite as small as I had hoped but it very light. Similar bags at REI were much more expensive. I did notice a slight odor, but will work on removing that. The owner sent three emails thanking me for my order, and provided unpacking, care, cleaning and storage instructions. He also advised me to contact him if I had any issues at all. So far, I am very pleased with the purchase and impressed with Hyke and Byke's after sales emails.
customer_reviews.author: steve hauk

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT..
customer_reviews.text: So small for my backpack... Yet comfy to lie ontop in hot weather and hot in be inside in cold weather.. used for three nights in 20 Deg weather with a good nights sleep... BUY...BUY...BUY... these FYI: I own 6 sleeping bags as I tried to find the right one.. This was my last to buy until I buy this one again... No I was not paid for this review...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bag smells like a zoo
customer_reviews.text: I searched and read lots of reviews on sleeping bags and thought this bag would be the one that i've been searching for. This bag looks beautiful lots of loft, pacs very small, and very warm. Unfortunately the smell coming out of this bag was so bad i returned it. Also every seam leaked feather pieces that will cover everything in your tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Miller

customer_reviews.title: very warm and cozy
customer_reviews.text: I tried it on a mid-temperature night and I was sweating. But it was also very humid. The fabric feels good. I do like to use a small because I prefer the feeling of cotton on my face. It was easy to put back in its back if folded properly.
customer_reviews.author: Croky

customer_reviews.title: I bought this one for my daughter who goes camping ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one for my daughter who goes camping almost every month with her scouts troop. She only used once in upper 30 degree weather. She said that it's very warm and light. The only thing I would have done different is just order the regular size instead of the long version. The long one is VERY long. Just ordered a 0 degree one for my husband since our daughter's troop is going to have a daughter and father camping trip in Jan.
customer_reviews.author: J.J.

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed...Great Product...
customer_reviews.text: I shopped online for weeks before purchasing..I just received it...I am very impressed with the Quality and feel. So much so, that I just ordered a second one for my son...and a third one for my wife a year later...spent 7 nights in yellowstone in October, stayed toasty warm all night
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN MEHERG

customer_reviews.title: GREAT VALUE
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy a sleeping bag that was from a brand I was unfamiliar with. After spending a weekend in 30 degree whether I was very impressed with the warmth and comfortability of the bag. I also love the fact that it stuffs into a sack so easily. I would recommend this bag to anyone who can't afford something at a higher price. You will not be dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Robins

customer_reviews.title: I rarely write reviews, but the Hyke & Byke ...
customer_reviews.text: I rarely write reviews, but the Hyke & Byke sleeping bags (I have 3) have filled a decades existing solution for the hiker. Down bags that are properly constructed and affordable. I lie there at night looking up at the sky & think, five stars for Hyke & Byke.
customer_reviews.author: Passin' Through

customer_reviews.title: Impressed.
customer_reviews.text: First mummy bag, first down bag. Since the instructions mentioned shaking it out and laying it out, that was the first thing I did after getting my tent up. It kept me toasty. I think the lows got down to upper 30, low 40s on the nights I used it. Looking forward to using it some more. Will follow up after a few more uses.
customer_reviews.author: kcleo

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME BAG AND GREAT VALUE.
customer_reviews.text: Hello, My bag arrived right on time with assurance that if i needed anything to call. It came compressed and i immediately opened and fluffed it out. There was absolutely NO Smell at all. I ordered the large model since I am 6 feet 3. I have all the room I need and more. Bag is very light and seems t be very warm. If i have only one complaint and that is rolling it back up and putting it back in compression bag by myself. It took a bit but successful. I guess with time I will get it down pat. Great bag and recommend highly. GOOD Job! Tom W
customer_reviews.author: Tom Walker

customer_reviews.title: Very nice bag especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and comfortable bag. Had 7 nights in Maine. Warm weather and just had this underneith on a pad. Looking forward to cooler weather this fall and will write more. One note: never had an issue with zipper jamming. Most lightweigth fabrics jam but for some reason this did not.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super Warm!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is very comfortable and I was quite snug laying in it. It is very warm, to the point you don't need to wear any layers to bed. This is the first mummy bag I've gotten where the hood actually fits around my head and pillow comfortably! I also like how lightweight the bag is. It fits in the compression bag, but just be careful because it seems flimsy. Also, the bag doesn't seem too durable, but if you take your time stuffing it in the compression bag, it should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Good sleeping back
customer_reviews.text: Good sleeping back. Couldn't try it in the outdoors because didn't go to the trip, but some attempts to try it indoors seems to be quite successful. But its 550 fill down, don't expect from it extreme warms, cus its not so puffy as higher quality downs. But very well done sleeping and compress bag
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Small, light weight, and warm bag. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag to take on a backpacking trip in the mountains. It's light, packs down well, and is warm. I used this bag in an hammock and it got down to 41 and I was nice and warm. In fact, I couldn't sleep with my head covered because it got too hot. I am very pleased with this bag and would highly recommend it. As a note, I read a lot of reviews about the zipper getting stuck. I never had any issues with the zipper being cheap or getting stuck.
customer_reviews.author: jay jones

customer_reviews.title: Really warm
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this bag. I have never been cold in it; in fact I wake up most nights pretty hot. I usually sleep with it unzipped a bit to let some cool air in. I do like that it has internal cords to tighten over my chest and the mummy hood incase it gets really cold. Every time I have used it I woke up really cozy in just thermal pants and shirt, while my friends all woke up cold and added jackets in their other bags. Haven’t tested in in much lower than 30 but I can already tell it will hold up just fine in the 20s
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: Great bag and great price
customer_reviews.text: After my last sleeping bag was torn I ordered this as a quick replacement. I have used it on two campouts now with temps in the 30's and was warm on both. The bag when unpacked lofts up nicely and after a bit of practice the zipper is no issue. I am a large guy and my model fits me well with a bit of room to move. If I need to replace any of my kids bags I believe i will buy another for them.
customer_reviews.author: John S. Linton

customer_reviews.title: The temps were comfortable for a low in the 30s
customer_reviews.text: Just bought this bag in Xlarge for a backpacking trip to NM. It fit me, 5’5” 145lbs woman and a 70lb dog. The temps were comfortable for a low in the 30s. Bag seems durable and fairly rip resistant so far. I bragged the whole time how much I loved this bag.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: Field tested it last weekend and she loved it. Lofts nicely and kept her almost too ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my wife's synthetic 15 degree Slumberjack bag. Field tested it last weekend and she loved it. Lofts nicely and kept her almost too warm. Overnight temps in the 60s, so this bag was kind of overkill but it packs small enough and is light enough to justify taking it for summer trips. Build quality is great too. Seems to be a great bag at a great price-point.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great Performance for Little Dinero!
customer_reviews.text: It has been a great bag. I've used it down to the low 20's and was always very comfortable. My feet may have bee a bit cold by morning, But over all, very warm. It's snug. What you would expect for a mummy bag. I broke one of the straps off the compression bag. I haven't repaired it yet, but looks easy enough. I'm 5'10 170lbs. Fit was good. Maybe the longer bag would be a bit warmer in the foot box.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Great sleeping bag
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag, I used it on a winter trip in AZ/ Utah got well under 15 and I had no problems also used it during a snow storm and it kept me warm. I had a few problems with the stitching, the zipper is a pain and the toe box is a little too big (my feet got cold), but for the price you can't beat it. Super lightweight easy to pack up and very spacious.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: hard to beat at this price point
customer_reviews.text: Overall very happy with this sleeping bag. I've only taken it out on two three day backpacking trips but it has held up well. At this price I was worried it was only going to last a short time but it's still in one piece. Pros: as compressible as described, very light, comfortable material for sleeping, down hasn't started poking out after two trips, good foot box, and kept me warm Cons: zipper snags (nothing new though)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This product is true to its description. So fluffy and comfy! I've not camped with it yet but am excited for the snow to melt so I can test her out proper. It was delivered the day I was told it'd be here.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Definitely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag works perfect. I haven't used in 15 degree weather yet, but I have used in 20-25 degree weather and I was pretty comfortable and warm. I learned that sleeping with wool socks, underwear and my down jacket is the way to go. Body warmth works way better then layering in clothes, in some cases. I shorted one star because I wish this bag compressed more, to fit better inside my hiking backpack. I love the color red. Best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Germain

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sleeping bag. I took it elk hunting this last fall. We camped 10miled into the back country where it snowed and sleeted everyday. Temps were single digits at night and I always felt toasty warm. Going to order another one for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Wilscobar

customer_reviews.title: Trust the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sleeping bag after I purchased a hyke & byke tent. The bag was rated for 15 degrees. I slept in it while it was 40 degrees outside and I was nice and warm. Soft and light wieght. This is a product where you can read and trust all the reviews.
customer_reviews.author: NW83

customer_reviews.title: great bag. light and compact
customer_reviews.text: great bag. light and compact. slept outside in ~35 degree weather was wishing i had brought shorts to sleep in instead of just my long jons. also looks dead sexy
customer_reviews.author: Mathew Ruberg

customer_reviews.title: lightweight, packs tightly, fluffs up nicely and keeps me very very warm.
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a good down sleeping bag at a reasonable price. This fit the bill. On my first camp trip, the temperatures went down into the high 30s/low 40s and this bag kept me toasty warm. It packs up very tightly and fits into my backpack easily. At home, I take it out of the stuff sack and drape it over a sturdy clothes hanger and put it in my closet. It stays very fluffy and I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: J. Threlkeld

customer_reviews.title: kept me warm and dry
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely pleased with my purchase. I am very cold natured and this bag kept me very comfortable. It is also light weight and compresses well for backpacking. We had a terrible leak in our tent, and the sleeping bag kept me from getting completely soaked, didn't get wet at all, even though there was water dripping from the ceiling and standing in the bottom of the tent
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Webb

customer_reviews.title: Quality well made bag.
customer_reviews.text: Best bag I’ve ever had. Extra light for the long hauls. Needs fluffing up a bit before getting in to distribute the goose down but to be expected.
customer_reviews.author: Max Headroom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: I am 6’1 250lbs. Pretty big guy. Don’t write long reveiws so the short of it is that the bag is pretty good. Length wise def awesome. Width wise it was just a snug for me. I tried it in my apt so didn’t get to take it out but I was just at comfortable. I don’t see you really using this below 45 degrees without layers. The material was great otherwise. Had to return it as I needed a little extra room in the bag. The weight is accurate too and it lacks down reallllly well for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best bag I have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality. I will never buy any other brand. Great length for those who are tall. Excellent customer service as well.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Richerson

customer_reviews.title: Good bag for price.
customer_reviews.text: Used the bag for the first time with temps in mid thirties. I actually had to keep the bag loosely open because I was too warm. I expect it to work as rated. The bag is very compact and easy to carry and scrunch back into compression sack. Zipper is easy to use. Good bag for the price.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: Super warm, but not compact.
customer_reviews.text: Not good for fast packing, but my god is it warm. It will keep you comfortable in 20 - 30° no problem. Might be good for hikers though. This sleeping bag will take up 60 or 70% of space in a regular bag. Not feasible for the WAA ultrabag
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: The zipper was horrible. I couldn't get my bag closed
customer_reviews.text: The zipper was horrible. I couldn't get my bag closed, and when I finally did, it wouldn't open. Definitely returning.
customer_reviews.author: MnemonicSpace

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bag for what I need, solo backpacking and hammock camping. Perfect all-around sleeping bag for those cooler nights in the Spring and Fall. Add a liner and you're all set for winter camping too. Quality materials, and the down lofts beautifully. Store it out of the stuff-sack (I hang mine in the closet from the provided loops at the foot) and it'll be warm and cozy for your chilly night. Thanks guys for making a great product. I'm sure I'll be getting a few summer weight bags for my kids later this year.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bags at an amazing price
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bags at an amazing price! I shopped around for a while and made several trips to REI...where I looked at a bunch of their bags as well. However, they were all priced really high, for bags that don't even compete with Hyke and Byke. My boyfriend and I both have these bags and have tested them in the high country in Colorado! They are super light, extremely warm, and great quality. I would highly recommend this bag if you are looking for a great bag at a great price point.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Lee

customer_reviews.title: Good sleep is priceless!
customer_reviews.text: Great sleeping bag. Light weight, small, warm and good quality. I took this on an overnight backpacking trip with 2 ft of snow on the ground and temperatures around 15degrees at night and stayed warm and slept well all night(paired with a klymit insulated pad).. I am really impressed with the zippers.. they work flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Asassin

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I unboxed this I could tell it was very cheaply made. Then I held it up to the light and could see right through it! How can this possibly keep you warm. I didn’t even try this out, however I did get inside it and was warm and cozy. I just wasn’t impressed with the quality. Got me a Kelty! That bag is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Randall Oz

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I just took this out for a 4 day backpacking trip in the High Uintas. Temperatures at night were in the 20s. I was never remotely cold. It's light and packs super easily. I would recommend it unequivocally!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Orgill

customer_reviews.title: Best camping experience!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I used it camping this weekend, sleeping it this was so comfy. I couldn’t believe how warm yet lightweight this is. I almost overslept that’s how comfy I was!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Good loft for the money
customer_reviews.text: Good loft for the money. Packs in to its stuff sack pretty tightly. Would prefer a little less circumference when packed, but I'm expecting the thick loft will keep me toasty and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As soon as I pulled the sleeping bag out of it's carrying bag I fell in love, it is ultralight
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant about giving the all 5 stars but only because I have not used it outside yet. As soon as I pulled the sleeping bag out of it's carrying bag I fell in love, it is ultralight, the light blue is exactly what you see, and the material is as soft as butter! I immediately layed it out so I could get in and try it, after being in there only a few minutes I could already feel my body heat warming things up. I am 5,6 and 190lbs and to me had plenty of wiggle room. I look forward to getting out on the trail with this asap!
customer_reviews.author: Windwhisper

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Warm!!!
customer_reviews.text: This sleeping bag is amazing! I recently did a 5 night backpacking trip in Glacier National Park. I get cold very easily and the nights were very chilly. This sleeping bag kept me warm every night. I did add a sleeping bag liner, but that was more for ease of cleaning than warmth. The bag is easily compressible and fit into the sleeping bag compartment of my backpack. I did buy a Big Agnes compression girdle, the one that came with the bag broke right away.
customer_reviews.author: WillowAnne

customer_reviews.title: Great functionality & quality.
customer_reviews.text: Tested during the cold blast in South Georgia this past week. Put sleep pad down on a cot then bag. Wore ultra thin thermal top/bottom and crawled in the bag. Cinched top shut and slept comfortable. Temps low 20s with wind chill in low teens. Zipper easy to operate in dark w/no snagging in fabric. Light weight as advertised. Compresses small and will fit easily in pack w/room. Impressed at how the down rebounds after a few minutes out of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: EJDG

customer_reviews.title: Save some money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don't spend $400 on an ENO bag!! This one works incredibly well and a quarter of the price
customer_reviews.author: amazonbuyer

product_meta.title: Hyke & Byke Quandary 15 Degree F 650 Fill Power Hydrophobic Down Sleeping Bag with ClusterLoft Base - Ultra Lightweight 3 Season Men’s and Women’s Mummy Bag Designed for Backpacking
feature_bullets: LIFETIME WARRANTY - Hyke & Byke products are 3rd Party Tested and IDFL Certified so you know you are getting what you pay for! Our gear has been tested on adventures worldwide by 60,000+ customers.

SAVE SPACE and SHAVE WEIGHT - Our new 2019 model is designed to maximize durability, warmth, and water resistance. Our quest for the perfect solution led us to utilize Hydrophobic 650 FP Duck Down with a revolutionary ClusterLoft base. ClusterLoft performs better than down for durability under compression and moisture resistance.

STAY WARM and DRY as a result of Hydrophobic Down insulation capabilities and waterproof fabrics - the microscopic air clusters found in down feathers creates "loft" that traps heat and keeps you warm. Extreme Limit is 15 Degrees F, Lower Limit (men) is 30 Degrees F, and Comfort Limit (women) is 50 Degrees F.

HIKE FARTHER with the LIGHTEST MUMMY DOWN SLEEPING BAG available (Short: 2.56 lbs., Regular: 2.71 lbs. & Long: 2.89 lbs.) for this quality at the price. Compare to other big brand names to see the price difference we achieve through direct-to-consumer sales. Summit any mountain or camp by the summer sea with these compact bags and have room for carrying your favorite fleece blanket or silk liner, goose filled pillow, and pad.

LONG LASTING DURABILITY from ultralight water repellent 400T 20 D ripstop nylon fabric liner with double large YKK zippers and anti-snag slider, wide shoulders and large footbox, snag-free velcro, drawstring, horizontal baffles, and compression stuff sack case for storage included. Comes in size Short (Individuals up to 5'6"), Regular (Individuals up to 6'), and Long/Tall/XL (Individuals up to 6'6").

HYKE & BYKE is a new brand of outdoor gear that started small but has quickly made a big impression on outdoor enthusiasts across the country (men, women, and kids alike). Our cosmic vision of providing double the value for every person (youth or adult) looking to go outdoors is possible through beating the big brands at cutting costs and connecting with our customers. See how we cut costs in our description below!

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
